Comment: the Chemical Engineering Plant Cost Index (CEPCI)
the Chemical Engineering Plant Cost Index (CEPCI)
to adjust the cost of the plant based on its size

References: Corn stover Ethanol transport is dominated by rail (from Greet), therefore used as proxy for transportation cost

Production Type: 1- Most of the data are based on the NREL study "Determining the Cost of Producing Ethanol from Corn Starch and Lignocellulosic Feedstocks", 1999,  https://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy01osti/28893.pdf
2- The range for the user-input "Yearly Ethanol Production Rate" is taken from: https://www.eia.gov/petroleum/ethanolcapacity/
3- The user-input "Capex_adjust_factor" is used to adjust the Capex relative to NREL base case
4- The feedstock cost range is taken from: https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2015/ee/c5ee00153f#!divAbstract
5- This analysis is "no incentive cot-analysis" type, meaning no tax credit for biofuel is considered
